questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription. Microsoft Priva Privacy Risk Management licenses are assigned to all users.

You need to review and delete all the personal data that relates to a former employee. The solution must minimize administrative effort.

What should you do first?

choices.D: From Data matching, add a personal data schema for the data profile.
choices.C: Purchase a Microsoft Priva Subject Rights Requests license.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
My copilot went for B (with double check to exclude C)... he states that C is more suitable to handled request from the departing/departed user himself than from an administrator performing the task... for sure, it's no A

Selected Answer: C
Subject Rights Requests is an add-on not included in E3/E5 so you need to purchase it
definitely has nothing to do with a retention policy

Selected Answer: C
Thinks its C
From CoPilot:

To review and delete all personal data related to a former employee with minimal administrative effort, you can use Microsoft Priva’s Subject Rights Requests feature. Here’s what you should do first:

Create a Subject Rights Request:
Go to the Microsoft Purview compliance portal.
Navigate to Priva Privacy Risk Management > Subject Rights Requests.
Select + New request and choose Delete as the request type.
Specify the Employee’s Identity:
Enter the former employee’s details to locate all personal data associated with them.
Review the Data:
Priva will compile the data related to the former employee. Review the data to ensure it is accurate and complete.
Delete the Data:
Once reviewed, you can proceed with the deletion of the data directly from the Priva interface.

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You need to configure the Microsoft Priva Privacy Risk Management policies to generate alerts for the following scenarios:

• Scenario1: A user shares a Microsoft SharePoint Online document library link with a user in a different country.
• Scenario2: A user from the sales department emails personal data to a user in a different country.
• Scenario3: The personal data stored on a Microsoft SharePoint Online site was NOT modified during the last 120 days.

Which policy template should you use for each scenario? To answer, drag the appropriate policy templates to the correct scenarios.

Each template may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

You need to ensure that User1 cannot communicate with the department2 users.
